checkExclusionFromNonSignerSet(bytes32,u.details: checkSignatures in DataLayrBLSSignatureChecker.sol enforces the invariant that hash of non-signers pubkey is recorded in the compressed signatory record in an  ascending manner.Reverts if the operator *is* in the non-signer set.

params.nonSignerIndex: such that if the relationship among nonSignerPubkeyHashes (nspkh) is: uint256(nspkh[0]) <uint256(nspkh[1]) < ...< uint256(nspkh[index])< uint256(nspkh[index+1]),... then, uint256(nspkh[index]) <  uint256(operatorPubkeyHash) < uint256(nspkh[index+1])

checkExclusionFromNonSignerSet(bytes32,u.notice: Check that the DataLayr operator who is getting slashed was actually part of the quorum for the dataStoreId. The burden of responsibility lies with the challenger to show that the DataLayr operator is not part of the non-signers for the DataStore. Towards that end, challenger providesMakes sure that operatorPubkeyHash was *excluded* from set of non-signers

checkInclusionInNonSignerSet(bytes32,uin.notice: Makes sure that operatorPubkeyHash was *included* in set of non-signers. Reverts if the operator is *not* in the non-signer set.

constructZeroPolyEval(uint256,uint32,uin.notice: This function evaluates the zero polynomial (x^ChunkLenE - (⍵^index * φ)^{ChunkLenE}) at point alpha         Recall that `φ = ⍵^NumSysE` and `⍵` is the `NumSysE * ChunkLenE`-th root of unity.          So, we are now left with evaluating `⍵^{index * ChunkLenE}`.

getDataCommitmentAndMultirevealDegreeAnd.notice: Parses the KZGMetadata from a DataStore header.

nextPowerOf2(uint256).notice: Finds the next power of 2 greater than n and returns it.

openPolynomialAtPoint((uint256,uint256),.notice: Opens up kzg commitment c(x) at r and makes sure c(r) = s. proof (pi) is in G2 to allow for calculation of Z in G1
